description.plain:
Megan Jovon Ruth Pete (b. February 15, 1995), better known by her stage name Megan Thee Stallion, is a rapper from Houston, Texas. She also goes by the nicknames “Tina Snow” and “Hot Girl Meg.”

Megan grew up the daughter of rapper Holly-Wood (aka Holly Thomas), listening to Southern rap staples like Three 6 Mafia and UGK from an early age. She started writing her own raps by age 14 and established her presence around the Houston rap circuit by battling and beating opponents in local freestyle competitions. She cites Biggie Smalls and, of course, Pimp C as her biggest influences.

The rapper signed with 300 Entertainment in November 2018, making her the first female artist on the label. Megan released her first full-length album Fever on May 17, 2019, following the success of the song “Big Ole Freak” from her Tina Snow mixtape.

On March 6, 2020, after having a dispute with her label for trying to “stop [her] music from being released,” Megan put out her third EP entitled Suga. It contained the viral hit “Savage,” a song about self-empowerment. The Beyoncé-assisted remix of the track, released in late April 2020 became her first number one single on the Billboard Hot 100 chart shortly after.

Explicit and sexually risqué, yet empowering lyrics combined with effortless flows became Thee Stallion’s signature sound. Megan strived to make all of the things that she thought sounded cool coming from her favorite male rappers, sound cool coming from her too, but as a woman. From her sexual personality on the mic, to her flow, to her nicknames (Tina Montana/Tina Snow), Pimp C made a heavy impression on Thee Stallion as a fellow Texan. Yet, while many of Pimp C’s lyrics were seen as sexist, Thee Stallion shows that coming from her, sexually forward lyrics are just as much an expression of personality as any other lyrics are.

Megan is also currently a full-time college student, studying health administration.

description.plain:
On the remix to Megan Thee Stallion’s hot single “Savage,” Meg teams up with fellow Houston native Beyoncé for the first time. The two first met at a New Year’s Eve party in December 2019:



On the track, Megan spits an entirely new verse, while Beyoncé name-drops various staples of the 2020 zeitgeist, referencing everything from the phrase “Demon Time” to TikTok and OnlyFans. It features two of them trading bars with additional backing vocals by Beyoncé.

Each artist’s share of proceeds will go to benefit The Bread Of Life COVID-19 relief efforts in  Houston. In response to the remix, Houston’s mayor, Sylvester Turner, made a commitment to give both Meg and Bey their own respective honorific “days”:

https://twitter.com/SylvesterTurner/status/1255682905113874435

description.plain:
“Cash Shit” was released along with Fever and is the first collaboration between Megan Thee Stallion and DaBaby.

Over a very simple beat provided by LilJuMadeDaBeat, the two artists elaborate on—as suggested by the title—their money: where they got it from and how they spend it.

description.plain:
Megan Thee Stallion decisively manifests herself as a “savage” on the second track from her third EP Suga, released on March 6, 2020. With plenty of references to her older songs and uplifting lyricism, it’s clear that Megan will indeed “forever be that bitch.”

Four days after Suga was released, choreographer Keara Wilson created an original dance to the track on TikTok, a popular video-sharing social media network. In the following days, the dance quickly became viral, even to the point of Megan shouting-out various TikTok creators putting their own spin to the dance.

The “Savage Remix” featuring Beyoncé was released on April 29, 2020 and an animated music video for the original version followed on May 21, 2020.
